statements.text: It's my right and privilege to smoke whenever I feel like it.
Sometimes I feel guilty when I'm smoking.
I think about the impact my smoking may have on friends and family.
I ask those around me if they mind I smoke.
Sometimes people complain about smoking when I'm in a social situation.
My friends and family often tell me I should stop smoking.
I smoke cigarettes almost without being aware of it.
When non-smokers complain about my smoking, it makes me angry.
It's not fashionable to smoke anymore.
I smoke more when I'm in a social situation.
I am sometimes bothered by other people smoking.
Smokers are under more pressure now from non-smokers than in the past.
Smoke-filled rooms are uncomfortable for both smokers and non-smokers.
I enjoy smoking most when I'm alone.
I try to show consideration for others when I smoke.
